intro: Delissea profuga, commonly known as the wandering lily, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a short, upright stem with narrow, grass-like leaves that help it blend into its natural habitat. Delissea profuga is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other ornamental and medicinal plants. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
